name: The Abbey of Crime Extensum
description: A free game inspired by Umberto Eco's novel and Jean-Jaques Annaud's film "The Name of the Rose", and based on the game "La abadía del crimen" by Paco Menéndez and Juan Delcán.
minimum_requirements: Memory: 256 MB RAM Storage: 512 MB available space

reviews.review_text: I loved the movie. Game follows the plot from the Name of the Rose movie. Even the main character looks exactly like Sean Connery. Soundtrack is good, it is similar 'bellringing' like in the movie. Moving is bit of clumsy. Sometimes AI was also clumsy and characters were blocking. This game has the best 'monastery murder mystery' -athmosphere as possible.

I've just remember this game since 32 years ago (I had my spectrum with 7 years and now I'm 39 years old...) and this remake is AWESOME.  I've been playing with for about 10 hours and is fully immersive and beautiful. What a wonderful game!!!!

looks like an old-fashioned game and you could actually play it and would be fun too if only it had a consistent sense of camera-direction as is common in games so you could actually keep a mental map for where you are
